title: LeFlore County Girl Injured In Accidental Shooting
content:
A 4-year-old LeFlore county girl is in critical but stable condition after she accidentally shot herself in the abdomen while camping with her family at the Cedar Lake campgrounds.
A 4-year-old LeFlore county girl is in critical but stable condition after she accidentally shot herself in the abdomen while camping with her family at the Cedar Lake campgrounds.
LeFlore County Undersheriff Kendall Morgan said authorities were dispatched to the area around noon Monday and spoke with family who said the girl was sleeping inside the camper trailer, and apparently woke up and somehow managed to get hold of a pistol that was inside of her mother's purse. She began playing with the weapon and evidently fired the weapon by accident, shooting herself in the abdomen.
The girl was airlifted to a Tulsa hospital, Morgan said.
He said details of the incident are unclear and officials will know more once they are able to speak with the girl. He added that the investigation is ongoing and authorities are considering the incident an accidental shooting.
No arrests have been made, Morgan said.
